meta.title: Database Integrations — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, and Firebase to Jet Admin to explore data, run queries, and build internal tools.

integrations.name: MySQL
integrations.tagline: Manage your MySQL data, build SQL queries in Jet Admin

meta.title: MySQL Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect MySQL to Jet Admin to browse tables, run queries, and build internal tools on top of your data.

integrations.content:
MySQL Integration

Connect your MySQL database to Jet Admin to explore tables, build queries visually, and power internal apps without boilerplate.

Key features
  • Secure read/write access with granular permissions
  • Visual query builder and SQL editor
  • Pagination, filters, and parameterized queries
  • Create, update, and delete records safely
  • Audit logs and environment-based connections
Getting started
  1. Go to Integrations → Databases → MySQL.
  2. Enter host, port, database, user, and password (or paste a connection URI).
  3. Whitelist Jet Admin IPs if required by your firewall.
  4. Test the connection and click Connect.
Use cases
  • Support dashboards (search users, refund orders)
  • Ops tooling (inventory updates, approvals)
  • Finance reporting (exports, reconciliation)
Requirements
  • MySQL 5.7+ or MariaDB-compatible
  • Network access from Jet Admin to your DB

Open the MySQL setup guide →
features: Connection pooling with query timeout controls
Explain plans and slow query insights
Bulk CSV/JSON import & export with schema mapping
Row-level guards and approval flows for writes
Secrets via environment variables or vault

integrations.name: MariaDB
integrations.tagline: Manage your MariaDB data, build SQL queries in Jet Admin

meta.title: MariaDB Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect MariaDB to Jet Admin to query data, manage records, and build internal tools rapidly.

integrations.content:
MariaDB Integration

Link your MariaDB instance to Jet Admin for fast querying, role-based access, and CRUD operations in minutes.

Key features
  • Visual data explorer with filters and search
  • SQL editor with parameters and templates
  • Safe mutations with confirmations and validations
  • Environment-specific credentials
Getting started
  1. Navigate to Integrations → Databases → MariaDB.
  2. Provide host, port, DB name, and credentials or a URI.
  3. Allow incoming traffic from Jet Admin IPs if needed.
  4. Test and connect.
Use cases
  • Customer success consoles
  • Content and catalog management
  • Operational analytics

Open the MariaDB setup guide →
features: Audit diff viewer for changed rows

integrations.name: PostgreSQL
integrations.tagline: Manage your PostgreSQL data, build SQL queries in Jet Admin

meta.title: PostgreSQL Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect Postgres to Jet Admin to browse schemas, run queries, and build secure internal apps.

integrations.content:
PostgreSQL Integration

Securely connect PostgreSQL and unlock visual querying, actions, and app building over your existing schema.

Key features
  • Schema-aware explorer and ER insights
  • Parameterized queries and stored procedures
  • Row-level actions & bulk updates
  • RBAC and audit trails
Getting started
  1. Open Integrations → Databases → PostgreSQL.
  2. Enter connection details or paste a connection URI.
  3. Configure SSL if required.
  4. Test and connect.
Use cases
  • Admin panels for SaaS
  • Ops workflows (refunds, flags, approvals)
  • Data exports for BI

Open the PostgreSQL setup guide →
features: Support for views, materialized views, and functions

integrations.name: Firebase
integrations.tagline: Manage your Firebase data in Jet Admin

meta.title: Firebase Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect Firebase to Jet Admin to browse collections, edit documents, and build tools on Firestore/RTDB.

integrations.content:
Firebase Integration

Plug in Firebase (Firestore or Realtime Database) to manage documents, run queries, and power internal tools.

Key features
  • Collection/document browser with filters
  • JSON editor with validation
  • Role-based permissions for edits
  • Actions and automations on document changes
Getting started
  1. Go to Integrations → Databases → Firebase.
  2. Upload service account JSON or connect via OAuth.
  3. Select project and data store (Firestore/RTDB).
  4. Test and connect.

Open the Firebase setup guide →
features: Firestore queries with compound indexes and cursors
Batch writes and transactions with rollback
Security rules preview against sample payloads

meta.title: Payment Gateway Integrations — Jet Admin
meta.description: Operate Stripe, PayPal, Square, and Razorpay inside Jet Admin to manage customers, payments, subscriptions, and refunds.

integrations.name: Stripe
integrations.tagline: Accept online payments and manage subscriptions with Stripe.

meta.title: Stripe Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect Stripe to Jet Admin to manage customers, charges, subscriptions, and refunds from one place.

integrations.content:
Stripe Integration

Operate your billing stack—customers, invoices, subscriptions—directly in Jet Admin.

Key features
  • Search customers, payments, disputes
  • Create/refund charges and manage subscriptions
  • Issue credits and handle coupons
  • Export payouts and reconciliation data
Getting started
  1. Open Integrations → Payments → Stripe.
  2. Connect your Stripe account via OAuth.
  3. Select live or test mode.
  4. Grant required scopes and finish.

Open the Stripe setup guide →
features: Subscription schedule edits with proration preview
Invoice creation, void, and PDF download
Dispute evidence upload and status tracking
Webhooks viewer for recent event payloads
Test/live mode switch with safe guards

integrations.name: PayPal
integrations.tagline: Enable secure transactions globally using PayPal.

meta.title: PayPal Integration — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect PayPal to Jet Admin to track transactions, issue refunds, and manage customers globally.

integrations.content:
PayPal Integration

Centralize PayPal payments and customer operations in Jet Admin.

Key features
  • Transaction search and filters
  • Refund and dispute workflows
  • Customer and subscription insights
Getting started
  1. Go to Integrations → Payments → PayPal.
  2. Authenticate with your PayPal Business account.
  3. Select environment (sandbox/live) and finish.

Open the PayPal setup guide →
features: Partial and full refunds with notes
Subscription plan changes and trial handling
Sandbox/live toggle with test data helpers

Open the Phillip Bank setup guide →

Getting started
  1. Go to Integrations → Authentication → Keycloak.

Open the Keycloak setup guide →

meta.title: File Storage & Media Integrations — Jet Admin
meta.description: Connect AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Dropbox, and Cloudinary to manage files and media from Jet Admin.

integrations.name: AWS S3

integrations.content:

Manage S3 buckets and objects directly from Jet Admin with role-based access.

  • Browse buckets and prefixes
  • Upload, download, delete objects
  • Signed URLs and metadata editing
Getting started
  1. Open Integrations → Storage → AWS S3.
  2. Enter Access Key, Secret, and Region with S3 permissions.
  3. Test and connect.

Open the AWS S3 setup guide →
features: Multipart uploads with automatic retry & resume
Lifecycle policies to Glacier/IA and expirations
Presigned URL generator with custom expiry
IAM role assumption (STS) for least privilege

Getting started
